page.title: 01KIRKCALDY-KINGHORN & WEST
page.content: This area of south east Fife is very largely taken up by arable farming, and contains no fewer than eighteen farms. The landscape is gently rolling, and overlooks the North Sea to the east and the Forth Estuary to the south. It incorporates the southern most part of Kirkcaldy, and the upper half of Kinghorn, as the two main residential parts of the area. Apart from farming, there is very little industry in the area, the main exception being Seafield Colliery on the outskirts of Kirkcaldy. There is also a confectionary factory at the edge of Kirkcaldy, and a small tannery just outside Kinghorn. Inland there is Kinghorn Loch which is currently being developed for leisure activities.
